column2: Read about these famous people. Choose the right verb:
column3: Jesse Owens {{c1::was}} a US athlete, born in 1913. In 1935 he {{c1::broke}} four world records, and in the following year he {{c1::won}} four gold medals at the Olympic Games in Berlin. His world record for the long jump {{c1::lasted}} 25 years. He {{c1::died}} in 1980 at the age of 66.

column2: Read about these famous people. Choose the right verb:
column3: Marie Curie {{c1::was}} a scientist, born in Poland in 1867. She {{c1::emigrated}} to France in 1891. She {{c1::discovered}} radium, and in 1911 she {{c1::won}} the Nobel Prize for Chemistry. She {{c1::died}} in France in 1934.

column2: Read about these famous people. Choose the right verb:
column3: Elvis Presley was a rock singer, born in 1935 in Mississippi, USA. He {{c1::began}} singing in his church choir and {{c1::taught}} himself to play the guitar. In the 1950s he {{c1::became}} one of the biggest stars of his time. His many hits {{c1::included}} Jailhouse Rock, Hound Dog and Blue Suede Shoes. He also {{c1::appeared}} in movies. He {{c1::had}} health problems and in 1977 he {{c1::died}} of a heart attack at the age of 42.
column4: appeared / became / began / died / had / included / taught
